paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data from affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: right breast cancer (invasive ductal carcinoma, stage T2N0M0, triple-negative)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient No. 1, a premenopausal 43-year-old woman, developed right breast cancer (invasive ductal carcinoma, stage T2N0M0, Figure 2) that was estrogen receptor (ER)-negative, progesterone receptor (PR)-negative, and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)-negative (i.e., triple-negative) in January 2016.

functional_data.summary: Frame shift mutation leading to truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in family history.
variants.additional_notes: Patient underwent preventive salpingo-oophorectomy and right preventive mastectomy.
key_quotes: This patient underwent preventive salpingo-oophorectomy and right preventive mastectomy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: triple-negative right breast cancer (invasive ductal carcinoma, stage T2N0M0)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient No. 2, a 36-year-old woman, developed triple-negative right breast cancer (invasive ductal carcinoma, stage T2N0M0) in October 2015.

functional_data.summary: Insertion leading to a premature stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in family history.
variants.additional_notes: Four years of routine follow-up revealed no evidence of disease.
key_quotes: Four years of routine follow-up revealed no evidence of disease.

individual_records.phenotype_details: bilateral breast cancer (right invasive ductal carcinoma and left ductal carcinoma in situ)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient No. 3, a 31-year-old woman, was diagnosed with bilateral breast cancer (right invasive ductal carcinoma and left ductal carcinoma in situ) in October 2011.

functional_data.summary: Base substitution leading to a premature stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in family history.
key_quotes: This patient underwent preventive bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy and has been taking tamoxifen as adjuvant hormone therapy for 8 years.

individual_records.phenotype_details: left breast cancer (triple-negative) and subsequent right breast cancer
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient No. 4, a 35-year-old woman, developed left breast cancer (triple-negative) in October 2003.

functional_data.summary: Base substitution leading to a premature stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in family history.
variants.additional_notes: No recurrence of breast cancer over a follow-up period of 126 months.
key_quotes: There was no recurrence of breast cancer over a follow-up period of 126 months.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations and variants of uncertain significance

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
